channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The FDA restricts a psychoactive mushroom used in some edibles
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration has told food manufacturers the psychoactive mushroom Amanita muscaria isn't authorized for food, including edibles, because it doesn't meet safety standards.
item.content:encoded:
The Food and Drug Administration has told food manufacturers the psychoactive mushroom Amanita muscaria isn't authorized for food, including edibles, because it doesn't meet safety standards.

(Image credit: KARL-JOSEF HILDENBRAND/DPA/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: People power's unfinished work: Can Bangladesh be an exception?
item.description: The Wilson Center's Michael Kugelman says that for many Bangladeshis, a successful youth-led mass movement has shattered a long malaise and kindled a newfound optimism about the country's future.
item.content:encoded:
The Wilson Center's Michael Kugelman says that for many Bangladeshis, a successful youth-led mass movement has shattered a long malaise and kindled a newfound optimism about the country's future.

(Image credit: Luis Tato)
item.dc:creator: Michael Kugelman

item.title: Latinos are the fastest-growing fanbase in the NFL. What's the league's playbook?
item.description: The NFL is reaching more Latinos than ever. Here's how they've scored with a Spanish-speaking audience.
item.content:encoded:
The NFL is reaching more Latinos than ever. Here's how they've scored with a Spanish-speaking audience.

(Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell)
item.dc:creator: Alan Chazaro

item.title: A pair of satellites will create artificial solar eclipses to study the sun
item.description: Astronomers hope the Proba-3 mission will help them get a better view of the corona, the sun's outer atmosphere, which is even hotter than the sun's surface.
item.content:encoded:
Astronomers hope the Proba-3 mission will help them get a better view of the corona, the sun's outer atmosphere, which is even hotter than the sun's surface.

(Image credit: ESA-P. Carril @ESA)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: How AI deepfakes polluted elections in 2024
item.description: The most visible use of AI in many countries was to create memes and content whose artificial origins weren't disguised. They were often openly shared by politicians and their supporters.
item.content:encoded:
The most visible use of AI in many countries was to create memes and content whose artificial origins weren't disguised. They were often openly shared by politicians and their supporters.

(Image credit: Dibyangshu Sarkar)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: The Fight for a Crucial City in Ukraine
item.description:
Ukrainian soldiers are struggling to stabilize defensive lines near the city of Pokrovsk, in the country's east, against Russia's much larger advancing army. We go to the front lines of Pokrovsk, to see how the fight is playing out.

Support our non-profit journalism by joining NPR+
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian soldiers are struggling to stabilize defensive lines near the city of Pokrovsk, in the country's east, against Russia's much larger advancing army. We go to the front lines of Pokrovsk, to see how the fight is playing out.

item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: A year in radio: Some of the favorite stories from 2024
item.description: Some of the All Things Considered staff whose voices you don't always hear on air share their favorite stories that aired on the show in 2024.
item.content:encoded: Some of the All Things Considered staff whose voices you don't always hear on air share their favorite stories that aired on the show in 2024.

item.title: What happens if Congress doesn't fund the government?
item.description: If lawmakers can't reach a deal to avoid a shutdown, many federal workers would be furloughed, while essential functions like Social Security payments would continue.
item.content:encoded:
If lawmakers can't reach a deal to avoid a shutdown, many federal workers would be furloughed, while essential functions like Social Security payments would continue.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Advocates want Biden to spare the lives of the 40 prisoners on federal death row
item.description: Anti-death penalty advocates hope President Biden will grant clemency to 40 people on federal death row. He has already commuted the sentences of nearly 1,500 people and pardoned 39 others.
item.content:encoded: Anti-death penalty advocates hope President Biden will grant clemency to 40 people on federal death row. He has already commuted the sentences of nearly 1,500 people and pardoned 39 others.
item.dc:creator: Chiara Eisner

item.title: Death toll in attack on German Christmas market rises to 5, with more than 200 hurt
item.description: The driver was arrested shortly after the car barreled into the market at around 7 p.m. on Friday, when it was teeming with holiday shoppers looking forward to the weekend.
item.content:encoded:
The driver was arrested shortly after the car barreled into the market at around 7 p.m. on Friday, when it was teeming with holiday shoppers looking forward to the weekend.

(Image credit: Ebrahim Noroozi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
